bug.author: ville-v
bug.summary: CV_XADD compile errors with Embarcadero C++ Builder 10.1
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV => 3.2 Operating System / Platform => Windows 64 Bit Compiler => Embarcadero C++ Builder 10.1, Clang-based bcc32c compiler
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
In cvdef.h, the following line fails to compile for two reasons #else CV_INLINE CV_XADD(int* addr, int delta) { int tmp = *addr; *addr += delta; return tmp; } #endif First is "[bcc32c Error] cvdef.h(442): C++ requires a type specifier for all declarations". Reason is the function has no return value, but it should return int. Second is "[bcc32c Error] ptr.inl.hpp(67): no matching function for call to 'CV_XADD'" "[bcc32c Hint] cvdef.h(442): candidate function not viable: no known conversion from 'unsigned int *' to 'int *' for 1st argument". The same error also occurs on line 72 in ptr.inl.hpp. <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Add OpenCV include file
#include <opencv2/core/core.hpp>
Try to compile

comments.comment:
Could you try to add "int":
CV_INLINE int CV_XADD(...)"
But using this branch you will compile thread unsafe code. Why _MSC_VER detection doesn't work?(your system is Windows - are you use cross-compilation?) Could you dump used compiler defines? It is something like clang -dM -E - < /dev/null, but with OpenCV specific flags (see make VERBOSE=1 or similar output). Also you can try to use CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS and define your custom CV_XADD macro (be careful with spaces). BTW, This platform is not supported officially. But we will accept reasonable patches, that don't break existed functionality.

I can make this branch to compile by adding "int" as you suggested, and changing PtrOwner::refCount to int in ptr.inl.hpp. But this might be an imperfect fix. I don't know if there are other files that use CV_XADD with unsigned int.

The command that should dump predefined macros does not seem to work this compiler. But the macros are listed in the documentation here: <denchmark-link:http://docwiki.embarcadero.com/RADStudio/Berlin/en/Predefined_Macros>http://docwiki.embarcadero.com/RADStudio/Berlin/en/Predefined_Macros</denchmark-link>
Basically, the compiler defines __BORLANDC__ and __clang__, and does not define _MSC_VER. C++ Builder 10.1. is "C++Builder Berlin".

Well, Could you try to change this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/3.2.0/modules/core/include/opencv2/core/cvdef.h#L423>line</denchmark-link> : - #elif defined __GNUC__ + #elif defined __GNUC__ || defined __clang__
